Description: PERFORMANCE GOALS  GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK (GRCA) HOSTS A ROBUST PRESCRIBED FIRE PROGRAM THAT ENCOMPASSES NOT ONLY THE NORTH AND SOUTH RIMS OF THE PARK, BUT INCLUDES WALNUT CANYON (WACA), WUPATKI, (WUPA), SUNSET CRATER (SUCR), TUZIGOOT (TUZI), AND MONTEZUMAS CASTLE (MOCA) NATIONAL MONUMENTS LOCATED NORTHERN ARIZONA.  PRIORITY FUELS REDUCTION AND ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION WORK OCCURS IN ALL LISTED LOCATIONS AND ASSISTANCE FROM QUALIFIED COOPERATORS WILL BE NECESSARY TO MEET THE PLANNED PROGRAM OF WORK.PROJECT OBJECTIVES  FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE ALLOCATED FOR PRESCRIBED FIRE SUPPORT, ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION, AND HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS, WHICH WILL BE NECESSARY TO MEET THE PROGRAMMATIC GOALS OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS).  THE RECIPIENT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF PRESCRIBED FIRE AND FUELS WORK INCLUDING THE ABILITY TO MOBILIZE AND ARRIVE AT THE PROJECT SITE WITHIN 2-4 HOURS OF NOTIFICATION, CAPABLE FIREFIGHTING EQUIPMENT, AND PERSONNEL POSSESSING NATIONAL WILDFIRE COORDINATING GROUP (NWCG) QUALIFICATIONS RECOGNIZED WITHIN THE WILDLAND FIRE DISCIPLINE.  BENEFICIARIES - THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS TO SUPPORT WORK THAT WILL DECREASE THE OCCURRENCE AND SEVERITY OF CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE THAT MAY THREATEN VISITOR AND EMPLOYEE SAFETY. BY CONDUCTING PRESCRIBED FIRE, ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION, AND THINNING ACTIVITIES WITHIN PARK UNITS THE SAFETY OF OUR FIREFIGHTERS, THE PUBLIC, SENSITIVE RESOURCES, AND CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE WILL INCREASE.  ADDITIONALLY, WITHIN THIS AGREEMENT, PUBLIC LAND THIS HAS BEEN ENTRUSTED TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL RECEIVE THE BENEFITS OF RETURNING FIRE TO A FIRE-ADAPTED ECOSYSTEMS.  A MORE RESILIENT AND DIVERSE ECOSYSTEM WILL BE PROMOTED FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS OF PARK VISITORS.

THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS COLLABORATION BETWEEN A NATIONAL NETWORK OF NPS AND MUSEUM PROFESSIONALS TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROJECTS THAT UTILIZE NPS AND PARTNER RESOURCES TO RESPOND TO COMMUNITY NEEDS IN URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES. THE AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT COLLABORATIONS BETWEEN THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND THE AMERICAN ALLIANCE OF MUSEUMS TO CREATE A COMMUNITY OF LEARNING, INQUIRY, AND PRACTICE TO SUPPORT PROJECT DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION IN SOME OF THE NATIONS MOST POPULOUS CITIES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, NON-FEDERAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES, INDUSTRY AND PUBLIC DECISION MAKERS, RESEARCH SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO FACILITATE CONSULTATION BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF  P.L.106-465, THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE ESTABLISHMENT ACT OF 2000.   THIS LEGISLATION STATES THE NEED TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE TRIBE TO BE INVOLVED IN THE MANAGEMENT PLANS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: FACILITATE THE PARTICIPATION OF THE FOUR OFFICIALLY-DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND OFFICIALLY-CALLED, GENERAL CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:NHS RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND EDUCATION PLANNINGDEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTIONREPATRIATION AND ANY OTHER ISSUES RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NAGPRAAN ANNUAL MEETING SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE TO HELD AT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITEDEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL PLAN TO ADDRESS PROJECTED CONSULTATION NEEDSDISTRIBUTE INFORMATION DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES RECORD OR RECEIVE FROM NPS DURING CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO TRIBAL CONSULTANTS, GENERAL TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP, TRIBAL LEADERSHIP, AND OTHER PARTIES CONSIDERED APPROPRIATE BY THE TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES. PROVIDE THE SERVICES OF TRIBAL CREWS, RESOURCE MANAGERS, OR SPECIALISTS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO CARRY OUT, OVERSEE, OR MONITOR NPS-SPONSORED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED ON-SITE AS DETERMINED NECESSARY BY THE DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TO CONDUCT DISCUSSIONS AND BEGIN PLANNING THE SITE OF A CONTEMPLATIVE AREA WITHIN THE PARK BOUNDARIES.  INITIATE LONG-TERM RESOURCE PLANNING OF NEWLY ACQUIRED 3,478 ACRES OF PARK PROPERTYBENEFICIARIES: THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES AND MANAGEMENT PLANNING THAT IS APPROPRIATE FOR THIS SIGNIFICANT SITE.

THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE COOPERATIVE RELATIONSHIPS THAT WILL FULFILL THE MISSION AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK AND THE SUBSEQUENT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES THE PARK WILL BRING TO KIOWA COUNTY. KCEDF HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE PARTNER IN THE ONGOING DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK SINCE 2001, BEFORE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE PARK.  THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN KCEDF AND NPS WILL CONTINUE TO ALLOW THE POSITIONING OF NPS TO BE AN ECONOMIC DRIVER FOR THE DOWNTOWN AREA OF THE GATEWAY COMMUNITY.  THE COMMUNITY, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF KCEDF, HAS ACTIVELY PURSUED THE PRESERVATION OF THE HISTORIC DOWNTOWN OF EADS, COLORADO.  NPS WILL WORK WITH KCEDF ON COLLABORATION FOR THIS EFFORT, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE VISITOR AND EDUCATION CENTER WHICH IS LOCATED IN ONE OF THE HISTORIC BUILDINGS.KCEDF WILL:A.WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NPS IN THE COORDINATION OF GATEWAY COMMUNITY PLANNING EFFORTS AND THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, TOURISM AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION IN THE COUNTY AS RELATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK.B.ASSIST WITH PLANNING OF GENERAL PUBLIC INFORMATION AND PARTNERSHIP CONSULTATION MEETINGS THAT ARE HELD IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.C.ASSISTANCE WITH PLANNING AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT FOR THE GRAND OPENING OF THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NHS VISITOR CENTER.D.COORDINATE THE LOCAL LOGISTICS SUCH AS MEETING SPACE, LODGING, LOCAL TRANSPORTATION, ETC.NPS WILL:A.PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE VI.B.ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN IDENTIFYING PARTNERS, GRANT SOURCES, ETC. THAT MAY HAVE A BEARING ON THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN KIOWA COUNTY AS A RESULT OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK.C.PROVIDE CURRENT INFORMATION ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK TO THE RECIPIENT FOR PROMOTIONAL PURPOSES.D.PARTICIPATE ON TOURISM COMMITTEES AND WITH OTHER RELEVANT GROUPS THAT HELP KIOWA COUNTY PLAN FOR ITS ROLE AS A GATEWAY COMMUNITY TO THE PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL LEAD TO SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE, NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE, THE CHEYENNE AND ARAPAHO TRIBES, AND THE LOCAL GATEWAY COMMUNITIES.  THE GOAL IS GREATER COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION AND AN IMPROVED ECONOMIC FOUNDATION FOR THE AREA. BENEFICIARIES ARE THE VISITING AND LOCAL PUBLIC, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS AND THE TRIBAL PARTNERS.  A MORE ROBUST ECONOMIC AND TOURISM BASE BENEFITS THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY.

PRINT, MAIL, AND COMPILE DATA FROM FLOW METERS AT PERMITTED WELL SITES WITHIN THE YELLOWSTONE CONTROLLED GROUNDWATER AREA. ZAPATA COUNTY PROPOSES SITE IMPROVEMENTS TO AN EXISTING VISITOR REST AREA PULL-OUT AND OVERLOOK SITE, LOCATED ON U.S. HIGHWAY 83, JUST NORTH OF SAN YGNACIO, TEXAS. THE SITE IS OWNED BY THE TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (TXDOT) AND IS MANAGED BY BOTH TXDOT AND ZAPATA COUNTY. IT HOLDS MANY UNIQUE SCENIC QUALITIES AND HAS DIRECT TIES TO THE HISTORIC RIO GRANDE RIVER CROSSING SITE OF EL CAMINO REAL DE LOS TEJAS NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (NHT). AT THIS SITE, VISITORS CAN EXPERIENCE THE ONLY EXISTING AND UNINTERRUPTED VIEWPOINT OF THE RIO GRANDE RIVER, OVERLOOK ACROSS THE US MEXICO BORDER, AND OBSERVE A LANDSCAPE THAT REMAINS LARGELY UNIMPAIRED BY ANY MODERN-DAY INTRUSIONS. THIS IS THE ONLY SITE FROM SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS TO SAN YGNACIO, TEXAS THAT ALLOWS THE PUBLIC A CLEAR VIEW OF THE RIVER AND THE US MEXICO BORDER.ONSITE AMENITIES CURRENTLY INCLUDE A LARGE DETERIORATING ASPHALT PULLOUT OFF THE HIGHWAY, AND UNDEFINED PARKING AREA, AN OLDER PICNIC SHELTER, AND A LOWER-LEVEL OVERLOOK VIEWING AREA THAT IS OVERRUN WITH NOXIOUS WEEDS. IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCLUDE: RE-PAVING OF THE PULLOUT, PARKING AREA, AND SHORT PATHWAY ALONG THE PICNIC SHELTER LEADING TO THE OVERLOOK  THE ADDITION OF TWO HANDICAP PARKING SPACES, STRIPING OF THE PARKING AREA  PAINTING OF THE COVERED PICNIC SHELTER  AND SITE IMPROVEMENTS OF THE OVERLOOK VIEWING AREA, INCLUDING WEED REMOVAL, LEVELING, AND RESURFACING USING AN ADA COMPLIANT NATURAL SURFACE MATERIAL. INTERPRETIVE MEDIA FOR THIS SITE WAS RECENTLY COMPLETED BY THE NPS-NATIONAL TRAILS OFFICE. THE PANELS WERE INSTALLED ONSITE IN 2021.

THIS AWARD IS INTENDED TO BENEFIT THE PUBLIC, BLACKFEET TRIBE, AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE BY PROVIDING FUNDING TO THE BLACKFEET TRIBE FOR AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES INSPECTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS DESIRING TO BOAT IN GLACIER NATIONAL PARK. THE BLACKFEET TRIBE WILL ESTABLISH 2 NEW INSPECTION STATIONS NEAR THE TWO MEDICINE AND ST. MARY PARK ENTRANCE STATIONS AND INSPECT ALL BOATERS PASSING BY THOSE STATIONS. THEY WILL ISSUE DOCUMENTATION TO THE PUBLIC THAT WILL SERVE TO DOCUMENT THE INSPECTION AND SHOW INSPECTION COMPLIANCE TO NPS STAFF. NPS WILL RE-OPEN PARK LAKES TO BOATING FOLLOWING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THESE INSPECTION STATIONS.

LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE IN RESEARCHING, INVENTORYING, DOCUMENTING, AND NOMINATING HISTORIC PLACES AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH LATINX HISTORY AND HERITAGE. LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION WILL ALSO PROVIDE RESEARCH, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND EDUCATION FOR PROGRAMMING AND INTERPRETATION. IN ADDITION, LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION WILL PERFORM TARGETED COMMUNITY OUTREACH, SCHOLARS ROUNDTABLES, AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT WITH LATINX COMMUNITIES TO PROMOTE HISTORIC PRESERVATION GOALS AS WELL AS CULTURAL HERITAGE STEWARDSHIP.  LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION SHALL FACILITATE STAKEHOLDER   PROPERTY OWNER MEETINGS, AND RESEARCH POTENTIAL HISTORIC SITE DESIGNATION. LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION SHALL COMPILE RELEVANT RESEARCH ON TWO AGREED UPON LATINX HISTORIC SITES IN ORDER CONSIDER WHETHER THESE SITES ARE NATIONALLY SIGNIFICANT FOR THEIR ASSOCIATION WITH LATINX HISTORY IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE  NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK CRITERIA FOR EVALUATION OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES. LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION SHALL DEVELOP TWO LOIS THAT EXAMINES THE NATIONAL HISTORIC THEMES FOR WHICH THE SELECTED SITES WOULD BE CONSIDERED SIGNIFICANT AND HOW THE INDIVIDUAL SITES REPRESENT THOSE THEMES. COMPARISONS WITH SIMILAR PROPERTIES WILL BE DISCUSSED AS WELL AS THE APPLICABLE NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK CRITERIA FOUND IN THE NHL BULLETIN. LATINOS IN HERITAGE CONSERVATION SHALL REFINE AND REVISE THE LOI BASED ON STAKEHOLDER AND NPS FEEDBACK, TO PRESENT THE FINAL FINDINGS OF THE LOI THAT WILL INFORM FUTURE RESEARCH, SCHOLARSHIP, AND POTENTIAL DESIGNATION STRATEGIES FOR THE IDENTIFIED PROPERTIES.

15.954SAM.GOV LINK: CLICK HERE FOR THE SAM.GOV ASSISTANCE LISTINGTEMPLATE: THE NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM IS THE PRINCIPLE MEANS THROUGH WHICH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) EVALUATES AND IMPROVES THE HEALTH OF WATERSHEDS, LANDSCAPES, AND MARINE AND COASTAL RESOURCES, SUSTAINS BIOLOGICAL COMMUNITIES ON THE LANDS AND WATERS IN PARKS, AND ACTIVELY ENDEAVORS TO IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY OF THESE NATURAL RESOURCES AND ADAPT THEM TO THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO ENTER INTO A PARTNERSHIP WITH THE RECIPIENT FOR PURPOSES OF COOPERATIVELY OPERATING THE USGS SNAKE RIVER GAGE AT MOOSE, WYOMING, (13013650) AND TO COORDINATE IN THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF TEMPERATURE SENSORS AT USGS GAGES ON PACIFIC CREEK (13011500) AND THE GROS VENTRE RIVER AT KELLY, WYOMING (13014500). THIS AGREEMENT OUTLINES PROCEDURES AND DIRECTION FOR 1) CONTINUED SNAKE RIVER GAGE OPERATION, AND 2) OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF TEMPERATURE SENSORS AT EXISTING STREAMGAGES IN GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE PRINCIPAL GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE EFFECTIVE, COORDINATED NOXIOUS WEED CONTROL AND HERBICIDE PURCHASE BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE TETON COUNTY WEED AND PEST DISTRICT (TCWP).SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON TREATING AND MAPPING POPULATIONS OF INVASIVE PLANTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GOALS, MILESTONES, AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE ENGAGING WITH LAND MANAGERS ON ADJACENT LANDSCAPES, SHARING INFORMATION GAINED BY THE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE TETON COUNTY WEED AND PEST, CROSS BOUNDARY LANDSCAPE SCALE VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, AND A HEALTHIER VEGETATIVE ECOSYSTEM.BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC, THE JACKSON HOLE WEED MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATION, GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK LAND MANAGERS, AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

PURPOSE THE NEXT GENERATION RANGERS WILL BE GIVEN A COMPREHENSIVE HANDS ON OVERVIEW OF ALL AREAS OF MODERN FACILITY MANAGEMENT AND  MAINTENANCE IN THE NPS. INCUMBENTS WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE IN AREAS OF FACILITY MANAGEMENT TO INCLUDE TRADE SKILLS, OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE (OAND M), ASSET MANAGEMENT, AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT. INCUMBENTS WILL LEARN BEST SAFETY PRACTICES AND ASSIST IN MITIGATING RISK IN THE PARK. THEY WILL ALSO BE GIVEN OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADDITIONAL CROSS TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN OTHER DIVISIONS OF THE NPS.OBJECTIVES UTILIZING NPS STAFF TO MENTOR NEXT GENERATION RANGERS, INTERNS WILL LEARN SKILLS TO STRENGTHEN THEIR EXPERIENCE IN FACILITY MANAGEMENT COMPETENCIES, LEARN RESUME BUILDING SKILLS TO COMPETE SUCCESSFULLY FOR FUTURE POSITIONS WITHIN THE NPS OR OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES, DEVELOP AND FOSTER POSITIVE AND PROFESSIONAL WORKING RELATIONSHIPS, AND GAIN SKILLS IN RISK MANAGEMENT SAFETY. DURING THE INTERNSHIP, NEXT GENERATION RANGERS WILL BE TAUGHT HOW TO NAVIGATE THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPLICATION PROCESSES AND APPLY COMPETE FOR CAREER POSITIONS. ONCE THE FIRST PHASE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS COMPLETE, PUBLIC LAND CORP HOURS OF 640 WILL BE ACHIEVED, AND EFFORTS FOR COMPETITIVE JOB PLACEMENT WILL BE ENCOURAGED.

THE EMERALD TRAIL STEWARDS (ETS) WILL BE A GREEN WORKFORCE TRAINING AND BROWNFIELD EDUCATION PROGRAM. STEWARDS WILL BE RESIDENTS FROM THE 14 EMERALD TRAIL NEIGHBORHOODS AND TRAINED TO INSTALL AND MAINTAIN THE NATIVE LANDSCAPES AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE ALONG THE EMERALD TRAIL THROUGH A COMBINATION OF CLASSROOM AND ON THE JOB TRAINING. FUNDING THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE CREATION OF A SIX MONTH TRAINING PROGRAM, INCLUDING CURRICULUM AND COURSE WORK THAT LEADS TO PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATIONS IN HORTICULTURE, LANDSCAPE DESIGN, AND CLEAN WATER CONSERVATION  HIRING AND TRAINING TWELVE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS EMERALD TRAIL STEWARDS  AND CERTIFYING FIVE STEWARDS AS CLEAN WATER PROFESSIONALS, HORTICULTURAL PROFESSIONALS, AND LANDSCAPE TECHNICIANS. STEWARD PARTICIPANTS WILL BE PAID A GRADUATED STIPEND THAT INCREASES WITH SUCCESSFUL CERTIFICATION. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, NON FEDERAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES, INDUSTRY AND PUBLIC DECISION MAKERS, RESEARCH SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

GGNPC SHALL PROVIDE A SEAMLESS FEE COLLECTION EXPERIENCE TO THE VISITING PUBLIC THAT CONTRIBUTES TO EFFICIENT AND EQUITABLE ACCESS TO MUIR WOODS NATIONAL MONUMENT  MUWO , GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA  GGNRA , AND OTHER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE  NPS  SITES. GGNPC SHALL ISSUE AND SELL INTERAGENCY AND PARK-SPECIFIC RECREATION PASSES AT MUWO AND OTHER GGNRA SITES TO OFFER VISITORS COST-EFFECTIVE OPTIONS FOR ACCESSING FEDERAL LANDS. GGNPC SHALL ORIENT VISITORS TO RESOURCES, FACILITIES, AND SERVICES AT MUWO TO SUPPORT POSITIVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES AND FOSTER STEWARDSHIP OF PARK RESOURCES. PURPOSE OF AWARD:TO PROVIDE FACILITATION OF EDUCATIONAL AND INTERPRETATION PUBLIC PROGRAMS THAT WILL INCLUDE WORK-STUDY PROJECTS THAT ENGAGE LOCAL YOUTH FROM TRADITIONALLY UNDER-REPRESENTED COMMUNITIES. OUTREACH PROGRAMMING WILL PROVIDE CURRICULUM-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL PROGRAMS FOR TITLE 1 STUDENTS FROM THE GREATER LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY AREAS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS FUND (SMMF) AND THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA (SAMO). THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE RECRUITMENT OF AN INDIVIDUAL AS AN EDUCATION PROGRAM COORDINATOR (EPC) WHO WILL SERVE AS A LIAISON WITH PARTNERS AND FACILITATE PROGRAMS FOR STUDENTS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SMMF WILL OFFER ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND WORK-STUDIES PROGRAMMING FOR STUDENTS K-12 AND UNIVERSITIES AT LOCATIONS WITHIN THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA AND AT APPROVED PARTNER LOCATIONS. THESE PROGRAMS ARE SET TO ENGAGE WITH APPROXIMATELY 25,000 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS FROM THE GREATER LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES ANNUALLY. THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, SMMF WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION, APPROVED EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, AND STAFF SUPPORT. IN ADDITIONAL TO BUILDING CONNECTIONS FOR K-12 STUDENTS THIS PROGRAM WILL ALSO PROVIDE WORK-STUDIES INTERNSHIPS FOR 6 TO 18 UNIVERSITY STUDENTS ANNUALLYPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR INNER-CITY K-12 YOUTH TO PARTICIPATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES EDUCATION PROGRAMS WHILE ALSO PROVIDING A CAREER PATH FOR UNDERREPRESENTED COLLEGE STUDENTS THROUGH A WORK-STUDY PROGRAM WHICH SUPPORTS PUBLIC LANDS. THE PROJECT PROVIDES MULTIPLE CURRICULUM-BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS ON SAMO, CSP, AND OTHER PUBLIC LANDS. THESE K-12 VIRTUAL AND IN-PERSON PROGRAMS WILL BUILD PERSONAL CONNECTIONS AND ACCESS TO PUBLIC LANDS FOR TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES IN LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES. THROUGH DISTANCE LEARNING PROGRAMS, STUDENTS WILL SEE NATURAL FEATURES AND HISTORIC OBJECTS THAT CONNECT BACK TO THEIR PERSONAL STORIES AND COMMUNITIES. AND FOR THE MAJORITY OF THESE STUDENTS, THROUGH THIS PROGRAM THEY WILL VISIT THEIR FIRST NATIONAL PARK OR STATE PARK.BENEFICIARIES:K-12 YOUTH

TO PROVIDE INDIGENOUS YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS WITH A PLACE-BASED CULTURAL EXPERIENCE IN THEIR ANCESTRAL HOMELANDS NOW LOCATED IN NPS SITES. INTRODUCE NATIVE YOUTH TO CAREERS IN THE NPS THAT ALLOW FOR PARK MANAGEMENT, AUTHENTIC INTERPRETATION, RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND OTHER NPS CAREER PATHS.CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTERGENERATIONAL LEARNING WHERE NATIVE YOUTH TRAVEL WITH AND LEARN FROM THEIR ELDERS THROUGH INDIGENOUS CONNECTIONS TO PLACE AND HISTORY. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE FUNDS TO NATIVE YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS NONPROFIT GROUPS, SCHOOLS, OR TRIBAL GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS TO COVER THE COST OF TRAVEL FROM THEIR HOMES/RESERVATIONS TO AN NPS SITE.PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS WITH PLANNING AND EXECUTING THEIR TRAVELS BY CONNECTING THEM TO PARK STAFF. GIVE THE NPS STAFF AN ONSITE TRAINING OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN THE YOUTH GROUP AND THEIR ELDERS TO LEARN A NEW PERSPECTIVE OF THE PARK, ITS HISTORY, AND NATURAL HISTORY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OVER 1000 YOUTH ARE ANTICIPATED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM AGAIN THIS YEAR. EACH TRIP TAKEN TO A NATIONAL PARK UNIT WILL ALSO INCLUDE ELDER SUPPORT AND TEACHING AS THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO BRING NATIVE YOUTH ALONG WITH AT LEAST ONE ELDER FROM THEIR TRIBE TO THEIR ANCESTRAL LANDS TO WALK IN THE PLACES OF THEIR ANCESTORS, LEARN OF THE PLACES AND MEANINGS OF THEIR TRADITIONAL HOMES, EXPERIENCE A NATIONAL PARK SITE AND BE EXPOSED TO THE PROFESSIONS IN NATIONAL PARKS.

PERFORMANCE GOALS -BRING NATIVE TOURISM STAFF AND COMMUNITIES TOGETHER WITH NPS STAFF TO BUILD RELATIONS AND ENCOURAGE COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUPPORTING CULTURAL INTERPRETATION INITIATIVES, CULTURAL TOURISM PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND ENGAGEMENT WITH TRIBES AS THEY SHARE THEIR STORIES WITH GENERATIONAL PERSPECTIVES, AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEARNING FROM ALL THREE GROUPS - AIANTA, NPS AND TRIBAL TOURISM PROGRAMS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PLANNING EFFORT WILL ACCOMPLISH EARLY CONCEPTUAL PLANNING AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT FOR THE MIRAMONTES TRAIL AT PHLEGER ESTATE, A TRAILS FOREVER PRIORITY PROJECT. THE PHLEGER ESTATE, LOCATED IN SAN MATEO COUNTY, IS USED BY HIKERS AND EQUESTRIANS WITHIN A SECOND GROWTH REDWOOD FOREST. MIRAMONTES TRAIL HAS BEEN CLOSED FOR EXTENDED PERIODS BY LANDSLIDES AND EROSION INTO WEST UNION CREEK. THE TRAIL IS CURRENTLY CLOSED TO ALL VISITORS FOLLOWING A STORM EVENT IN DECEMBER 2021. THE CONCEPTUAL PLANNING IS ANTICIPATED TO TAKE PLACE IN 2022-24. THIS WORK WILL BUILD OFF A TRAIL PLANNING STUDY COMPLETED IN 2020SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO COLLABORATE ON DATA COLLECTION, EARLY STUDIES, PRELIMINARY PLANNING, FOR THE MIRAMONTES TRAIL AT PHLEGER ESTATE. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE PARK TO REQUEST FUNDS FOR FUTURE STAGES THAT ARE CURRENTLY UNFUNDED UNTIL THERE IS A PROPOSED PROJECT PLAN. THE 2020 TRAIL PLANNING STUDY RECOMMENDS RE-ALIGNING THREE SEGMENTS OF THE MIRAMONTES TRAIL TOTALING APPROXIMATELY ONE-HALF MILE. THIS INCLUDES RE-ROUTING THE HIGHEST PRIORITY SEGMENT 150-200 FEET UPSLOPE TO AVOID AN ACTIVE SLIDE, REPLACING AN EXISTING BRIDGE TO A NEW LOCATION OUTSIDE OF A SEASONAL CREEK CHANNEL, AND RELOCATING A PORTION OF EXISTING TRAIL UPSLOPE TO AVOID FUTURE CREEK EROSION. THIS PROJECT WOULD COMPLETE BACKGROUND STUDIES, CREATE A SUGGESTED PREMILINARY TRAIL ALIGNMENT WITH ALTERNATIVES AND PHASING, MAP EXISTING RESOURCES AND PROPOSED RAIL ALIGNMENTS, INITIATE COMPLIANCE, AND MANAGE THE PARK INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM. THE PROJECT PLANNING WOULD CONSIDER RESTORATION PLANS FOR THE EXISTING TRAIL CORRIDOR.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE IN DOCUMENTING NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND VISITOR ACCESS INFORMATION NEEDED FOR INFORMED DECISION-MAKING ABOUT FUTURE TRAIL DESIGN AND ALIGNMENT. BACKGROUND DATA COLLECTION AND PRE-PLANNING WORK WITH GGNPC STAFF WILL ALL HELP INFORM LONGER TERM DESIGN AND ENGINEERING EFFORTS. THE GGNPC FACILITATOR AND PROJECT MANAGER WILL WORK WITH PARK STAFF TO HELP CLARIFY THE PROJECT GOALS AND LONG TERM PLANS FOR THIS AREA. THIS EFFORT WILL ENABLE THE PARK TO REQUEST FUNDS FOR FUTURE STAGES (DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION) THAT WILL GO THROUGH CONTRACTING PROCESSES, AND CURRENTLY UNFUNDED UNTIL THERE IS A PROPOSED PROJECT PLAN. THIS WORK WILL HELP THE PARK TO IMPLEMENT A TRAILS FOREVER PRIORITY AS WELL AS IMPROVE RECREATION ACCESS AND SAFETY FOR VISITORS.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC BENEFIT, TRAIL USERS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): STUDENTS FROM FORT SCOTT HIGH SCHOOL AND FORT SCOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE WILL CONDUCT RESEARCH OF AFRICAN AMERICANS OR EVENTS ASSOCIATED WITH FROM THE FORT SCOTT AREA.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE A INSTRUCTIONAL SEMINAR ON VIDEO PRODUCTION AND VIDEOGRAPHY. STUDENTS WILL PRODUCE VIDEOS SHARING THEIR RESEARCH AND EXHIBITS WILL BE PRODUCED BASED ON THE STUDENTS' RESEARCH.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: STUDENTS WILL GET THE OPPORTUNITY TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP INTERPRETATIVE RESOURCES TO INCLUDE VIDEO, PHOTOGRAPHIC RESOURCES, SITE BULLETINS, AND CURRICULUM BASED EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES WHICH WILLBENEFICIARIES: PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTION/ORGANIZATION,STATE,LOCAL,OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTION/ORGANIZATION,PROFIT ORGANIZATION,PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION/ORGANIZATION,FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS,SCIENTIST/RESEARCHERS,ENGINEER/ARCHITECT,ANYONE/GENERAL PUBLIC.

ASSESS AND SUPPORT GROUNDWORK TRUST'S ORGANIZATIONAL HEALTH BY CONDUCTING ORGANIZATIONAL REVIEWS AT GROUNDWORK TRUSTS AND SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE NETWORK'S NEWEST TRUSTS. COMMUNICATE THE WORK OF THE GROUNDWORK NETWORK TO A BROAD AUDIENCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PERFORMANCE GOALS, MILESTONES AND OUTCOMES ARE TRACK VIA BIANNUAL PERFORMANCE REPORTING AND INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING. EVALUATE AND REFINE METHODOLOGY FOR CONDUCTING ORGANIZATIONAL REVIEWS OF GROUNDWORK TRUSTS AND TEST NEW REFINED METHODOLOGY IN 2023.COLLECTION OF ANNUAL IMPACT DATA IN 2022, AND DISTRIBUTION OF ANNUAL IMPACT REPORT, BROWNFIELD AND LAND USE SNAPSHOT REPORT, AND ACCOMPLISHMENT STORIES IN 2023. COORDINATE AND HOST SIX VIRTUAL CALLS FOR THE GROUNDWORK USA NETWORK IN 2022-2023.

UNDER THIS TASK AGREEMENT, GW MKE WILL COLLABORATE WITH MPCB TO ENGAGE METCALFE PARKNEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS IN AN EDUCATION CAMPAIGN AND IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLIMATE RISKMITIGATION PLAN FOR THE EASTERN PORTION OF METCALFE PARK. GW MKE AND MPCB WILL HIRE LOCALRESIDENTS AND HOST A SERIES OF COMMUNITY MEETINGS TO ENGAGE AND EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUTTHE CURRENT CONTAMINATION ON THE PROJECT AND HOW CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS THE SITE. THEY WILL THENENGAGE IN A PROCESS TO DEVELOP A CLIMATE RISK PLAN FOR THE PROJECT SITE.

NPS SERVICE-WIDE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL DEVELOP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT INTRODUCE VOLUNTEERS TO THEIR LOCAL NATIONAL PARK AND INTRODUCE THEM TO PARK ECOSYSTEMS; CULTURAL AND HISTORIC RESOURCES; RESTORATION PROCESSES; AND RECREATIONAL, INTERPRETIVE AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES. - NPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL DEVELOP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT APPEAL TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND PHYSICAL ABILITIES. - NPS SITES AND PROGRAMS ACROSS THE NATION WILL REACH OUT TO AND INVITE A BROAD AND DIVERSE BASE OF CONSTITUENCIES TO PARTICIPATE IN NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY EVENTS. - NPS SITES AND PROGRAMS WILL CAPITALIZE ON NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY (AN ENTRANCE-FEE FREE DAY) TO INVITE PEOPLE NEW TO THE NPS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DAY'S ACTIVITIES. - NPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL USE THE ONLINE TOOLS AND RESOURCES ON THE NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY WEBSITE TO DEVELOP AND ADVERTISE PROJECTS AND RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS. AVAILABLE TOOLS INCLUDE SITE-MANAGER RESOURCES, A PROMOTIONAL TOOLKIT, FAQ SHEETS, VOLUNTEER RECOGNITION IDEAS AND TOOLS, AND AN ONLINE RECRUITMENT AND VOLUNTEER PLACEMENT TOOL THAT ENABLES PEOPLE TO FIND AND SIGN UP FOR PROJECTS. - NPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL ENGAGE COMMUNITIES THROUGH ONLINE RESOURCES BY SHARING STORIES ABOUT VOLUNTEER AND PROJECT IMPACTS.- NPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL USE THE ONLINE SYSTEM, DEVELOPED BY THE RECIPIENT, TO REPORT ON NPS PARTICIPANT STATISTICS AND WILL CONTRIBUTE TO AN AGENCY, DEPARTMENT, AND INTER-AGENCY NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY ANNUAL REPORT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO FACILITATE CONSULTATION BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE ESTABLISHMENT ACT OF 2000. THIS LEGISLATION STATES THE NEED TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE TRIBE TO BE INVOLVED IN THE MANAGEMENT PLANS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:FACILITATE THE PARTICIPATION OF THE FOUR OFFICIALLY-DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND OFFICIALLY-CALLED, GENERAL CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:NHS RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND EDUCATION PLANNINGDEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTIONREPATRIATION AND ANY OTHER ISSUES RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NAGPRAAN ANNUAL MEETING SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE TO HELD AT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITEDEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL PLAN TO ADDRESS PROJECTED CONSULTATION NEEDSDISTRIBUTE INFORMATION DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES RECORD OR RECEIVE FROM NPS DURING CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO TRIBAL CONSULTANTS, GENERAL TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP, TRIBAL LEADERSHIP, AND OTHER PARTIES CONSIDERED APPROPRIATE BY THE TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES.PROVIDE THE SERVICES OF TRIBAL CREWS, RESOURCE MANAGERS, OR SPECIALISTS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO CARRY OUT, OVERSEE, OR MONITOR NPS-SPONSORED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED ON-SITE AS DETERMINED NECESSARY BY THE DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOALS FOR 2022 ARE:TO CONDUCT DISCUSSIONS AND BEGIN PLANNING THE SITE OF A CONTEMPLATIVE AREA WITHIN THE PARK BOUNDARIES. INITIATE LONG-TERM RESOURCE PLANNING OF NEWLY ACQUIRED 3,478 ACRES OF PARK PROPERTYBENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES AND MANAGEMENT PLANNING THAT IS APPROPRIATE FOR THIS SIGNIFICANT SITE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE COOPERATIVE RELATIONSHIPS THAT WILL FULFILL THE MISSION AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK AND THE SUBSEQUENT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES THE PARK WILL BRING TO KIOWA COUNTY.KCEDF HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE PARTNER IN THE ONGOING DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK SINCE 2001, BEFORE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE PARK. THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN KCEDF AND NPS WILL CONTINUE TO ALLOW THE POSITIONING OF NPS TO BE AN ECONOMIC DRIVER FOR THE DOWNTOWN AREA OF THE GATEWAY COMMUNITY. THE COMMUNITY, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF KCEDF, HAS ACTIVELY PURSUED THE PRESERVATION OF THE HISTORIC DOWNTOWN OF EADS, COLORADO. NPS WILL WORK WITH KCEDF ON COLLABORATION FOR THIS EFFORT, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE VISITOR AND EDUCATION CENTER WHICH IS LOCATED IN ONE OF THE HISTORIC BUILDINGS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:KCEDF WILL:WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NPS IN THE COORDINATION OF GATEWAY COMMUNITY PLANNING EFFORTS AND THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, TOURISM AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION IN THE COUNTY AS RELATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK.ASSIST WITH PLANNING OF GENERAL PUBLIC INFORMATION AND PARTNERSHIP CONSULTATION MEETINGS THAT ARE HELD IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.ASSISTANCE WITH PLANNING AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT FOR THE GRAND OPENING OF THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NHS VISITOR CENTER.COORDINATE THE LOCAL LOGISTICS SUCH AS MEETING SPACE, LODGING, LOCAL TRANSPORTATION, ETC.NPS WILL:1. PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE VI.2. ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN IDENTIFYING PARTNERS, GRANT SOURCES, ETC. THAT MAY HAVE A BEARING ON THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN KIOWA COUNTY AS A RESULT OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK.3. PROVIDE CURRENT INFORMATION ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK TO THE RECIPIENT FOR PROMOTIONAL PURPOSES.4. PARTICIPATE ON TOURISM COMMITTEES AND WITH OTHER RELEVANT GROUPS THAT HELP KIOWA COUNTY PLAN FOR ITS ROLE AS A GATEWAY COMMUNITY TO THE PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL LEAD TO SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE, NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE, THE CHEYENNE AND ARAPAHO TRIBES, AND THE LOCAL GATEWAY COMMUNITIES. THE GOAL IS GREATER COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION AND AN IMPROVED ECONOMIC FOUNDATION FOR THE AREA.BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES ARE THE VISITING AND LOCAL PUBLIC, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS AND THE TRIBAL PARTNERS. A MORE ROBUST ECONOMIC AND TOURISM BASE BENEFITS THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):WORK JOINTLY TO PROMOTE, ENHANCE, AND MANAGE FOR SUSTAINABLE CLIMBING IN THE NEW RIVER GORGE NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE WITH A SHARED VISION OF PROTECTION, CONSERVATION, AND STEWARDSHIP.CLIMBER STEWARDS WILL ACTIVELY ENGAGE WITH VISITORS DURING THE PRIME CLIMBING SEASON, SPRING THROUGH FALL, AND WOULD IMMEDIATELY CONNECT VITAL EDUCATION, LOW IMPACT BEST PRACTICES WITH VISITING CLIMBERS. CLIMBER STEWARDS WOULD RELY UPON A HOST OF TRUSTED OUTREACH STRATEGIES AND EDUCATION TECHNIQUES TO CONNECT WITH VISITING CLIMBERS - MEETING THEM WHERE THEY ARE AND WITH A COMMON CLIMBING BOND. CLIMBER STEWARDS, INVESTING THEIR TIME IN THE AREA WOULD GAIN A SENSE OF CONNECTION AND CONVEY CRITICAL MESSAGES NECESSARY TO PROTECT THIS SPECIAL LANDSCAPE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CLIMBER COFFEE MORNINGSCLIMBER STEWARDS WOULD HOST 3 CLIMBER COFFEE EVENTS EACH WEEK, FACILITATING CONVERSATION AND CONNECTION. MORNING EVENT LOCATIONS WOULD FLUCTUATE BETWEEN TRAILHEADS, PARKING LOTS AND CAMPGROUNDS. CLIMBER STEWARDS PROGRAM WOULD PROVIDE COFFEE TO ENTICE CLIMBERS INTO COMING AND FACILIATATE INTERACTION, DISTRIBUTE HUMAN WASTE BAG, SHARE AREA INFORMATION, AND HOST VISITING EDUCATIONAL SPEAKERS.CLIFFSIDE CHATSCLIMBER STEWARDS' ROLE WOULD BE TO CONNECT WITH CLIMBERS WHERE THEY ARE. CLIFFSIDE CHATS WOULD INCLUDE VISITING VARIOUS WALLS AND CONNECTING WITH CLIMBERS; GROUP SIZE, ACCESS EROSION, CLOSURES, CULTURAL CONCERNS, BIOLOGICAL CONCERNS, REGULATIONS AND PARKING PRACTICES WOULD ALL BE DISCUSSION POINTS. CLIMBING WOULD BE VOLUNTARY AND NOT SPECIFICALLY INCLUDED AS A REQUIREMENT.STEWARDSHIP & VOLUNTEERISMCLIMBER STEWARDS WOULD PLAY A VITAL ROLE IN CONNECTING VISITING CLIMBERS TO OPPORTUNITIES FOR INVOLVEMENT THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM AND STEWARDSHIP - WHETHER TRAIL DAYS, INVASIVE WEED REMOVAL, TRASH PICK-UP OR ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES A STEWARD WOULD BE THE TIE KEEPING OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:IMPROVE THE LONG-TERM PROTECTION AND COMMUNITY COMMITMENT TO THE NEW RIVER GORGE.CLIMBER STEWARDS WOULD SPEND A TOTAL OF 28 DAYS DURING THE BUSIEST CLIMBING MONTHS: MAY THROUGH OCTOBER, LIVING IN THE HEART OF THE CLIMBING SCENE. THE CLIMBER STEWARDS WOULD BE DOCENTS, DEDICATED TO CREATING A DEEPER CONNECTION BETWEEN THEMSELVES, VISITING CLIMBERS TO CONVEY CRITICAL MESSAGES NECESSARY TO PROTECT THIS SPECIAL LANDSCAPE.BENEFICIARIES:NPS VISITORS, PARK MANAGEMENT, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS

THIS PROJECT HAS TWO GOALS.IMPLEMENT USFWS APPROVED SURVEYS TO DOCUMENT PRESENCE OF MIGRATORY OR TERRITORIAL BIRDS IN NESTING HABITAT IN THE RATTLESNAKE SPRINGS UNIT.CONDUCT AN ADDITIONAL TRANSECT UTILIZING THE PROTOCOL IN FORAGING HABITAT AND OTHER AREAS OF INTEREST IN THE POTENTIAL DEVELOPMENT AND ACTIVITY ZONE OF RATTLESNAKE SPRINGS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES.THE PARK INVENTORY WILL IMPLEMENT THE SURVEY PROTOCOL RECOMMENDED BY THE USFWS. THIS PROTOCOL DOCUMENTS THE PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF THE SPECIES AND DETERMINES THEIR STATUS AS TERRITORIAL OR MIGRANT BIRDS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):ENHANCE QUAGGA MUSSEL CONTAINMENT EFFORTS BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, UTAH DIVISION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES (UDWR) AT GLEN CANYON NATIONAL RECREATION AREA. INCREASE ABILITY TO INPUT/GENERATE RECORDS OF BOATS USED AT LAKE POWELL INTO REGIONAL ANS INSPECTION DATA BASE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:UTAH DIVISION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES WILL IMPLEMENT AUTOMATED VESSEL CAPTURE SYSTEMS AT 2 LAKE POWELL LAUNCH RAMPS- STATELINE AND BULLFROG NORTH. AUTOMATED SYSTEMS WILL CAPTURE BOAT REGISTRATION NUMBERS, COAST GUARD VESSEL NAMES AND OTHER IDENTIFYING INFORMATION OF BOATS ARRIVING AND DEPARTING THE LAUNCH RAMPS ON A 24-HOUR, 365-DAY BASIS TO INCLUDE TIMES OF HIGH VISITATION, AT NIGHT AND AFTER HOURS WHEN STAFF ARE NOT PRESENT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:UTAH DIVISION OF WILDLIFE WILL IMPLEMENT AUTOMATED VESSEL CAPTURE SYSTEMS AT 2 LAKE POWELL LAUNCH RAMPS WITHIN THE 2023 AND 2027 FY'S. SYSTEMS WILL CAPTURE RECORDS OF LAUNCH/RETRIEVING BOATS. INFORMATION WILL BE RECORDED AS ALPHANUMERIC DATA. RECORDS WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY UPLOADED INTO THE REGIONAL ANS WATERCRAFT INSPECTION (WID) DATABASE FOR QUERY BY OTHERS AT ALTERNATE LOCATIONS IN REAL-TIME. IN FY 2023, UDWR WILL ACQUIRE AND PLACE EQUIPMENT IN IDENTIFIED LOCATIONS AND BEGIN TESTING OF FUNCTIONALITY. UDWR WILL IMPROVE UPON FUNCTIONALITY IN THE SUBSEQUENT FISCAL YEARS. DATA COLLECTED WILL BE ACCURATE AND VERIFIABLE.BENEFICIARIES:ALL WATER USERS AND RECREATIONALISTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. THE RISKS AND OUTCOMES OF SPREADING QUAGGA MUSSELS TO OTHER WATER BODIES IN THE US, ESPECIALLY IN THE WESTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY, IS EXTREMELY HIGH BOTH BIOLOGICALLY AND POLITICALLY. MUSSELS HAVE MAJOR IMPACTS TO AQUATIC ECOLOGY, LIMNOLOGY, RARE SPECIES AND INFRASTRUCTURE

PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA (SMMNRA) AND THE SAMO FUND WILL COORDINATE ACTIVITY FOR PUBLIC PROGRAMING EVENTS AND OUTREACH, BY UTILIZING NPS AND SMMF VOLUNTEERS AND THE HOLLYWOOD HERITAGE GROUP TO STRENGTHEN THE CURRENT INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING EVENTSOFFERED TO PARK VISITORS AROUND SIGNIFICANCE AND HISTORICAL REFERENCES OF FILMHISTORY AT PARAMOUNTRANCH.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE NPS WILL PARTNER WITH THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS FUND TO HELP BUILD INTERPRETIVE AND VOLUNTEER PROGRAMMING AROUND FILM HISTORY EVENTS, TOURS AND SPECIAL PROGRAMMING. THIS UNIQUE PARTNERSHIP WILL HELP NPS AND SMMF BRING IN SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS TO ENGAGE PARK VISITORS IN THE AREAS OF HOLLYWOOD HISTORY THIS WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC TO ENGAGE WITH VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS AND MEMBERS OF THE HOLLYWOOD HERITAGE GROUP WHO WILL BE ABLE TO PRESENT PROGRAMMING IN A WAY THAT OUR STAFF CANNOT PROVIDE. THIS WILL PROVIDE A CLOSER CONNECTION BETWEEN THE PARK, ITS COMMUNITIES, AND OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS THAT REPRESENT THE FILM HISTORY OF THE PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:A KNOWLEDGEABLE/TRAINED GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS AND MEMBERS OF THE HOLLYWOOD HERITAGE WILL BE RECRUITED TO PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING EVENTS FOR THE PUBLIC. THIS WILL INCLUDESILENCE UNDER THE STARSPROGRAMS DURING THE SUMMER, AND OTHER MOVIE PRESENTATIONS DURING SPECIAL EVENTS TO HIGHLIGHT THE MOVIE MAKING WITHIN THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS. AS PART OF OVERALL EVENT INTRODUCTION, AN INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM WILL BE LED AND/OR INTERPRETIVE POPUPS AND INFORMATIONAL TABLES WILL BE ARRANGED, AS WAY TO INTRODUCE AND ENHANCE VISITOR KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE FILM HISTORY OF THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS AND PARAMOUNT RANCH.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC OUTREACH/COMMUNITY EVENTS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO FACILITATE CONSULTATION BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE ESTABLISHMENT ACT OF 2000. THIS LEGISLATION STATES THE NEED TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE TRIBE TO BE INVOLVED IN THE MANAGEMENT PLANS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:FACILITATE THE PARTICIPATION OF THE FOUR OFFICIALLY-DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND OFFICIALLY-CALLED, GENERAL CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:NHS RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND EDUCATION PLANNINGDEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTIONREPATRIATION AND ANY OTHER ISSUES RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NAGPRAAN ANNUAL MEETING SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE TO HELD AT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITEDEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL PLAN TO ADDRESS PROJECTED CONSULTATION NEEDSDISTRIBUTE INFORMATION DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES RECORD OR RECEIVE FROM NPS DURING CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO TRIBAL CONSULTANTS, GENERAL TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP, TRIBAL LEADERSHIP, AND OTHER PARTIES CONSIDERED APPROPRIATE BY THE TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES.PROVIDE THE SERVICES OF TRIBAL CREWS, RESOURCE MANAGERS, OR SPECIALISTS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO CARRY OUT, OVERSEE, OR MONITOR NPS-SPONSORED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED ON-SITE AS DETERMINED NECESSARY BY THE DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOALS FOR 2022 ARE:TO CONDUCT DISCUSSIONS AND BEGIN PLANNING THE SITE OF A CONTEMPLATIVE AREA WITHIN THE PARK BOUNDARIES. INITIATE LONG-TERM RESOURCE PLANNING OF NEWLY ACQUIRED 3,478 ACRES OF PARK PROPERTYBENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES AND MANAGEMENT PLANNING THAT IS APPROPRIATE FOR THIS SIGNIFICANT SITE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PROVIDE A SHUTTLE SERVICE FOR THE PURPOSE OF EXPANDING VISITOR ACCESS TO FRIJOLES CANYON IN BANDELIER, REDUCING IMPACTS TO PARK RESOURCES, AND ENHANCING THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE A SEASONAL VISITOR SHUTTLE SERVICE BETWEEN LOS ALAMOS COUNTY'S WHITE ROCK VISITOR CENTER IN WHITE ROCK, NEW MEXICO AND THE BANDELIER NATIONAL MONUMENT VISITOR CENTER IN FRIJOLES CANYON.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:OPERATE A SHUTTLE SERVICE 7 DAYS A WEEK OFFERING SERVICE FROM 9:00 AM TO 5:10 PM EACH DAY AT 30 MINUTE INTERVALS WITH ADJUSTED SHORTER INTERVAL SCHEDULE OPTIONS FOR WEEKENDS, HOLIDAYS AND PARK EVENTS. SHUTTLE SERVICE WILL RUN FROM MID MAY THROUGH MID OCTOBER.BENEFICIARIES:VISITORS, LOS ALAMOS COUNTY COMMUNITY AND THE NPS.

THE RECIPIENT AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE SHARE COMMON GOALS RELATED TO GEOLOGIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, PROMOTION OF AMERICAS GEOLOGICAL HERITAGE, COORDINATION OF EARTH SCIENCE WEEK AND NATIONAL FOSSIL DAY, AND STEWARDSHIP OF GEOLOGIC AND PALEONTOLOGICAL RESOURCES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO FACILITATE CONSULTATION BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE CHEYENNE AND ARAPAHO TRIBES PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, THE SAND CREEK MASSACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE ESTABLISHMENT ACT OF 2000. THIS LEGISLATION STATES THE NEED TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE TRIBE TO BE INVOLVED IN THE MANAGEMENT PLANS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:FACILITATE THE PARTICIPATION OF THE FOUR OFFICIALLY-DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND OFFICIALLY-CALLED, GENERAL CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF P.L. 106-465, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:NHS RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND EDUCATION PLANNINGDEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTIONREPATRIATION AND ANY OTHER ISSUES RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NAGPRAAN ANNUAL MEETING SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE TO HELD AT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITEDEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL PLAN TO ADDRESS PROJECTED CONSULTATION NEEDSDISTRIBUTE INFORMATION DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES RECORD OR RECEIVE FROM NPS DURING CONSULTATION MEETINGS TO TRIBAL CONSULTANTS, GENERAL TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP, TRIBAL LEADERSHIP, AND OTHER PARTIES CONSIDERED APPROPRIATE BY THE TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES.PROVIDE THE SERVICES OF TRIBAL CREWS, RESOURCE MANAGERS, OR SPECIALISTS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO CARRY OUT, OVERSEE, OR MONITOR NPS-SPONSORED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED ON-SITE AS DETERMINED NECESSARY BY THE DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOALS FOR 2022 ARE:TO CONDUCT DISCUSSIONS AND BEGIN PLANNING THE SITE OF A CONTEMPLATIVE AREA WITHIN THE PARK BOUNDARIES. INITIATE LONG-TERM RESOURCE PLANNING OF NEWLY ACQUIRED 3,478 ACRES OF PARK PROPERTYBENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES AND MANAGEMENT PLANNING THAT IS APPROPRIATE FOR THIS SIGNIFICANT SITE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) PREVENTION AND MONITORING (NOTABLY QUAGGA AND ZEBRA MUSSELS) TO THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER STORAGE UNIT AND THE WAYNE N. ASPINALL STORAGE UNIT. THE GOAL OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS), PARTNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IS TO PREVENT THE INTRODUCTION OF AIS INTO THESE CRITICAL, LINKED WATER BODIES - SEVERAL OF WHICH ARE MANAGED AND ADMINISTERED BY THE NPS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROTECT BLUE MESA RESERVOIR (ASPINALL UNIT MANAGED BY NPS) FROM AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES CONTAMINATION. PREVENTION IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH VESSEL INSPECTIONS AND BOATER EDUCATION AT 5 BOAT INSPECTION STATIONS (AND THROUGH BROADER COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH). BOATERS WILL BE EDUCATED ABOUT THE RISKS THAT AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) POSE TO RECREATIONAL RESOURCES AND THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES FOR ENSURING THEIR VESSELS ARE CLEAN, DRAINED, AND DRY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAIN AIS PREVENTION AT ESTABLISHED BOAT INSPECTION STATIONS WITHIN THE ASPINALL UNIT.PURCHASE CRITICAL EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES TO SUPPORT AIS OPERATIONS AT ALL INSPECTION STATIONSBENEFICIARIES:BLUE MESA RESERVOIR, CURECANTI NATIONAL RECREATION AREA, ASPINALL UNIT, SUPPORTS THE LARGEST COLD-WATER FISHERY IN COLORADO AND SERVES OVER ONE MILLION VISITORS EACH YEAR. THE ASPINALL UNIT ALSO PROVIDES CRITICAL AGRICULTURAL IRRIGATION WATER AND HYDRO-POWER GENERATION. IT IS AT VERY HIGH RISK FOR INTRODUCTION OF ZEBRA AND QUAGGA MUSSELS, NEW ZEALAND MUDSNAILS, AND RUSTY CRAYFISH.THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE OVERSEES 5 BOAT INSPECTION STATIONS AND THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT INSPECTION STATIONS AT ASPINALL UNIT SITES. APPROXIMATELY 6 YOUTH WILL STAFF THE BOAT INSPECTION STATIONS EACH YEAR AND WILL GAIN VALUABLE REAL-WORLD EXPERIENCE IN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT SUPPORTING THE PUBLIC PURPOSE. STAFF WILL INTERVIEW BOATERS TO EVALUATE RISK OF AIS CONTAMINATION, EDUCATE VISITORS ABOUT THEIR ROLE IN PREVENTING THE SPREAD OF AIS, AND DECONTAMINATE HIGH-RISK VESSELS THAT MAY BE HARBORING AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES. THESE FUNDS SUPPLEMENT OUR EXISTING PARTNERSHIP WITH COLORADO PARKS AND WILDLIFE, WILL SUPPLEMENT AIS BOAT INSPECTION STATION STAFF, ALLOW FOR EXPANDED ACCESS FOR OUR VISITORS, AND PROTECTION FOR THIS IMPORTANT RESOURCE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): TO COLLABORATE AND IMPLEMENT REGIONALLY IMPORTANT HABITAT RESTORATION WHICH STIMULATE PUBLIC PURPOSES SUCH AS EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. TO PROCURE NATIVE PLANT SEED, VIA FIELD INCREASE, FOR CARLSBAD CAVERNS/GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARKS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THIS NATIVE PLANT MATERIALS DEVELOPMENT FOR RESTORATION PROJECTS SHALL FUND COLLABORATION WITH THE INSTITUTE OF APPLIED ECOLOGY (IAE) TO WORK WITH A NATIVE SEED GROWER TO INCREASE SEED OF THREE SPECIES COLLECTED FROM CARLSBAD CAVERNS AND GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARKS. TOGETHER THIS COLLABORATION WILL LEVERAGE THE ONGOING WORK OF THE SOUTHWEST SEED PARTNERSHIP. THIS WORK WILL RESULT IN SEEDS FOR DIRECT USE ON THE PARKS RESTORATION PROJECTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OVERARCHING PERFORMANCE GOAL IS FOR THE RECIPIENT'S CONTRACTED GROWER TO UTILIZE NPS COLLECTED SEED TO ESTABLISH SEED INCREASE FIELDS AND MAXIMIZE PRODUCTION OF THE SPECIES PLANTED. NPS SHALL PROVIDE CLEANED, HAND-COLLECTED ACCESSIONS OF THE SEED TARGETED FOR THESE INCREASE FIELDS UPON AWARD OF THE CONTRACT. THREE SPECIES SHALL BE GROWN FROM THE FOLLOWING LIST: BOUTELOUA HIRSUTA, DIGITARIA CALIFORNICA, LYCURUS SETOSUS, MUHLENBERGIA EMERSLEYI, RATIBIDA COLUMNIFERA OR VERBESINA ENCELIOIDES. THE THREE SPECIES SHALL BE CHOSEN BY THE NPS IN CONSULTATION WITH IAE/GROWER UPON CONTRACT AWARD. THE RECIPIENT'S GROWER SHALL GROW PLUGS OF THIS SEED FOR OUTPLANTING INTO THREE ONE- ACRE FIELDS IN EITHER THE SUMMER OF 2022 OR SPRING OF 2023 (AS DETERMINED BY NPS AND IAE/GROWER) AND MAINTAINED FOR THREE GROWING SEASONS. FIELDS SHALL BE OUTPLANTED WITH 15,000 PLUGS PER ACRE. PRODUCED SEED SHALL BE CLEANED AND TESTED BY IAE'S GROWER. TESTING SHALL BE DONE BY EITHER NEW MEXICO STATE OR COLORADO STATE UNIVERSITY SEED LABS FOLLOWING AOSA PROTOCOLS. UPON RECEIPT OF THE SEED TESTS THE GROWER SHALL MAKE THE SEED AVAILABLE TO THE NPS.BENEFICIARIES: CARLSBAD CAVERNS AND GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARKS, OTHER NPS LANDS IN THE SOUTHWEST REGION THAT COULD DUPLICATE THIS STRATEGY/SCOPE OF WORK, THE SOUTHWEST SEED PARTNERSHIP, AND INSTITUTE FOR APPLIED ECOLOGY.

THE RECIPIENT WILL IDENTIFY AND SUPPORT NPS PROJECTS THAT INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESS TO OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES, AND/OR BUILD RESILIENCY TO CHANGING CLIMATE CONDITIONS, AND/OR EVOLVE STEWARDSHIP OPPORTUNITIES AND INTRODUCING YOUTH TO SKILLS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ENJOY AMERICA'S WATERWAYS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE A VEHICLE TO ATTRACT NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS TO MATCH ONPS DOLLARS SUPPORTING NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION RELATED PROJECTS THAT ALIGN WITH GOALS OF LOCAL PROJECT PARTNERS, THROUGH THE CHALLENGE COST SHARE PROGRAM. THIS PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT PROVIDES AN EFFICIENT MODEL FOR IDENTIFYING AND FUNDING PROJECTS THAT BENEFIT NATIONAL PARKS, NATIONAL TRAILS, AND WILD AND SCENIC RIVERS. THE GOAL IS TO REACH OUT TO A BROAD AUDIENCE OF QUALIFIED ORGANIZATIONS, SUPPORTING AND CONTRIBUTING TO NPS' CONSERVATION, OUTDOOR RECREATION AND STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS WHILE ACHIEVING MUTUAL PARTNERSHIP GOALS.
NPS-FY22-IMR-NATIONAL PARK SERVICE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE      GOALS - THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS TO      COMPLETE A BACKLOG OF TRAIL MAINTENANCE PROJECTS AT MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL      PARK. PROJECT      OBJECTIVES - MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK AND WASHINGTON TRAIL ASSOCIATION      IN A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT ESTABLISH A PROGRAM DEDICATED TO COMPLETING      TRAIL MAINTENANCE PROJECTS THROUGH RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND LEADERSHIP      EFFORTS. THE COMPLETION OF THIS      WORK HELPS WITH THE PARK'S DEFERRED MAINTENANCE OF TRAILS AND KEEPS THOSE      TRAILS OPEN FOR PARK VISITORS TO ENJOY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:IN A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT, MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK AND WASHINGTON TRAILS ASSOCIATION WILL WORK WITH VOLUNTEER CREWS, CONSISTING OF APPROXIMATELY 10 INDIVIDUALS, WHO WILL FOCUS ON TRAIL RESTORATION WORK AND CORRECT DEFICIENCIES OF THOSE TRAILS. THE CREWS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS ON LOCAL TRAILS, THE CHALLENGES IN MAINTAINING VISITOR ACCESS, AND STRATEGIES FOR SUSTAINABLE DESIGN THE PARK ARE IMPLEMENTING. THE CREWS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE PROCESS TO CORRECT TREAD ISSUES. THE TRAILS WILL BE RESTORED TO GOOD CONDITION THROUGH CLEARING VEGETATION FROM THE TRAIL CORRIDOR, REPLACING CULVERTS, INSTALLING DRAIN BARS, AND ADDING TREAD MATERIAL WHERE NEEDED.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:COLLABORATE TO PERFORM TRAIL MAINTENANCE WITH THE VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL BE INVOLVED IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE TRAILS BRANCH. TRAIL RESTORATION PROJECTS REHABILITATE BACKCOUNTRY AND ACCESS TRAILS THROUGHOUT MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITOR WHO IS VISITING MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK AND TAKING HIKES THROUGH THE BACKCOUNTRY AND ACCESSES THE TRAILS SYSTEM.
MAKING WEATHER AND WATER DATA AVAILABLE AND USEFUL IN PARK MANAGEMENT AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE NPS GENERATED NATURAL RESOURCE INFORMATION (E.G. REPORTS, PUBLICATIONS, DATA) READILY AVAILABLE TO MANAGERS AND THE PUBLIC TO FACILITATE COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING WITHIN THE PARKS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT DEVELOPS REPORTS, PUBLICATIONS, AND WEB-BASED MATERIALS THAT FOLLOW EFFECTIVE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNICATION STANDARDS ON THE STATUS AND TRENDS OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THESE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE PRODUCTS WILL LINK MANAGERS AND THE PUBLIC TO THE BEST AVAILABLE SCIENCE FOR DECISION MAKING IN OVER 40 PARKS SUPPORTED BY FIVE NPS INVENTORY AND MONITORING NETWORKS. TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED TO NPS STAFF ON ENSURING MATERIALS MEET 508 COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE AMERICAN WITH DISABILITIES ACT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:OUTREACH MATERIALS IN THE FORM OF REPORTS, BRIEFS, WEB ARTICLES, WEBSITES, WILL PRESENT SCIENCE COLLECTED BY NPS SCIENTISTS AND PARTNERS IN A WAY THAT MEETS THE TARGETED AUDIENCES SUCH AS PARK MANAGERS, STAFF, AND THE PUBLIC. COOPERATOR WILL PROVIDE TRAINING ON HOW TO PREPARE MATERIALS, SO THEY ARE 508 COMPLIANT.BENEFICIARIES:NATIONAL PARK MANAGERS AND STAFF; PUBLICNPS INVENTORY AND MONITORING DIVISIONNORTHERN ROCKIES CONSERVATION COOPERATIVE

PERFORMANCE GOALSAQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) ARE AMONG THE GREATEST THREATS TO AQUATIC ECOSYSTEM INTEGRITY AND AQUATIC RESOURCE USER EXPERIENCE. AIS INCLUDE BOTH FLORA AND FAUNA, WHICH CAN HAVE TREMENDOUS IMPACTS ON NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS.DREISSENID MUSSELS (QUAGGA AND ZEBRA MUSSELS OR QZM) ARE EXAMPLES OF AIS THAT WERE INTRODUCED TO NORTH AMERICA IN THE BALLAST WATER OF TRANSOCEANIC SHIPS, DISCHARGED INTO THE GREAT LAKES. ONCE ESTABLISHED, BOTH SPECIES TYPICALLY HAVE NEGATIVE IMPACTS ON AQUATIC ECOSYSTEM PROCESSES, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE.AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES, SUCH AS ZEBRA AND QUAGGA MUSSELS AND AIS PLANTS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO CAUSE GREAT HARM TO THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEM IN LAKE CHELAN. THESE AIS SPECIES HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO DESTROY NATIVE FISH SPECIES ASSEMBLAGES, DESTROY NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES AND COMPROMISE ECONOMICALLY SIGNIFICANT INFRASTRUCTURE. THE CCDNR WOULD LIKE TO COMBINE RESOURCES WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TO STOP THE SPREAD OF AIS SPECIES AND PROTECT AND CONSERVE LAKE CHELAN'S ECOSYSTEM AND DIVERSITY OF NATIVE SPECIES AND PROTECT INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGHOUT THE LAKEPROJECT OBJECTIVESIDENTIFYING POTENTIAL AIS PREVENTION AND MITIGATION PROJECTS;ENGAGE LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS; CARRY OUT AIS PREVENTION STUDIES, PLANNING AND DESIGN OF PREVENTION/MITIGATION PROJECTS, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF APPROPRIATE EFFORTS;MONITOR THE RESULTS OF THE PROJECTS THROUGH PEER-REVIEWED METHODOLOGIES; AND SHARE MONITORING INFORMATION GATHERED FROM RESTORATION PROJECTS TO THE BROADER SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY THROUGH PUBLISHED REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS.THIS PROJECT WILL FOLLOW THE PROGRAM DEVELOPED BY THE CHELAN COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES FOR SAMPLING AND MITIGATION OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES. THIS PROGRAM HAS BEEN MINIMALLY CARRIED OUT, BUT WITHOUT ADDITIONAL FUNDING CANNOT BE FULLY IMPLEMENTED. THE WORK WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO WATERCRAFT INSPECTIONS/CHECK STATIONS; AND AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES SUPPRESSION EFFORTS (AIS VESSEL DECONTAMINATIONS).BENEFITS:VISITORS TO CHELAN LAKE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA

PROJECT OBJECTIVES - BUILDING BRIDGES ACROSS THE RIVER (BBAR)/ 11TH STREET BRIDGE PARK AND THE NPS PRESENT THE 7TH ANNUAL ANACOSTIA RIVER FESTIVAL; A PREMIER EVENT, AND OFFICIAL CLOSING, OF THE 2022 NATIONAL CHERRY BLOSSOM FESTIVAL.THIS FREE EVENT AIMS TO ENCOURAGE DISTRICT RESIDENTS AND OTHERS TO EXPLORE COMMUNITIES AND PARKS EAST OF THE ANACOSTIA RIVER.ENGAGE FAMILIES IN RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING FISHING AND CANOEING THAT WILL ALSO INTRODUCE THEM TO THE HISTORY AND ECOLOGY OF THE ANACOSTIA RIVER AND ITS ENVIRONS.PROMOTE STEWARDSHIP OF THE PARK BY HOSTING A VOLUNTEER EVENT TO DO A PARK SHORE-LINE CLEAN-UP.INCLUDE A FREE STAGE PERFORMANCE THAT WILL HELP TELL THE STORY OF THE HISTORY OF THE ANACOSTIA THROUGH MUSIC.THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TOPLAN, PROMOTE AND EXECUTE A 1-DAY FESTIVAL ON SUNDAY, APRIL 10TH THAT INCLUDES A PARK CLEAN-UP AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES IN THE MORNING FOLLOWED BY A STAGE PERFORMANCE IN THE AFTERNOON.FESTIVAL: APRIL 10 ACTIVITIES WILL BE WELL ATTENDED, SAFE AND ENJOYABLE. ACTIVITIES AND PERFORMANCES WILL ALSO HELP PARTICIPANTS LEARN MORE ABOUT PARK RESOURCES AND THE RIVER AND WILL ENGAGE MANY IN NEW ACTIVITIES THEY CAN EXPERIENCE IN THE PARK.BENEFICIARIES:COMMUNITIES AROUND ANACOSTIA PARK IN WARDS 6, 7 & 8 AS WELL AS OTHER INTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC WHO LEARN ABOUT THE EVENT AND ATTEND.

CROIX RIVER.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GOAL IS TO CONDUCT FIVE PROGRAMS IN THE FIRST YEAR. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE PRINCIPAL GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE EFFECTIVE, COORDINATED NOXIOUS WEED CONTROL AND HERBICIDE PURCHASE BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE TETON COUNTY WEED AND PEST DISTRICT (TCWP).SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON TREATING AND MAPPING POPULATIONS OF INVASIVE PLANTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GOALS, MILESTONES, AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE ENGAGING WITH LAND MANAGERS ON ADJACENT LANDSCAPES, SHARING INFORMATION GAINED BY THE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE TETON COUNTY WEED AND PEST, CROSS BOUNDARY LANDSCAPE SCALE VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, AND A HEALTHIER VEGETATIVE ECOSYSTEM.BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC, THE JACKSON HOLE WEED MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATION, GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK LAND MANAGERS, AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THIS PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED THROUGH A TASK AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE SOUTHEAST ARIZONA GROUP AND TUCSON AUDUBON SOCIETY. THE CONSERVATION BAT BIOLOGIST WILL COORDINATE AND COMPLETE THE BAT NETTING AND IN COOPERATION WITH SOUTHEAST ARIZONA GROUP SUPERINTENDENT AND CHIEF OF RESOURCES FOLLOWING BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES USED WITHIN THE PARK UNITS FOR OVER 20 YEARS. SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED YEAR-ROUND AND BAT WINGS WILL BE SWABBED FOR THE FUNGUS THAT CAUSES WHITE NOSE SYNDROME. DATA COLLECTED DURING THE WINTER MONTHS WILL REVEAL WHAT SPECIES ARE ACTIVE DURING THE COLD SEASON AND ALLOW US AN OPPORTUNITY TO CAPTURE ANY BATS THAT MAY HAVE THE SYNDROME AND PREMATURELY AWAKEN. SUMMER MONITORING AND BAT COUNTS WILL REVEAL MIGRATORY BEHAVIOR AND MONSOONAL BAT ACTIVITY. YEAR-ROUND BAT SURVEYS CAN REVEAL THE HEALTH OF THE LOCAL POPULATION AND CONTRIBUTE TO REGIONAL KNOWLEDGE OF BAT POPULATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL CONDUCT ~27 NIGHTLY SURVEYS A YEAR, WITH ONE SITE NETTED PER EVENING. THE DATA COLLECTED IN THIS STUDY WILL BE DOCUMENTED IN ANNUAL REPORTS, AND WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS, AND CITIZEN SCIENCE ACTIVITIES. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:AN EXPERIENCED AND KNOWLEDGEABLE BAT BIOLOGIST WILL SUPERVISE ALL OF THE NIGHTLY BAT MIST NETTING SESSIONS. BAT NETTING SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED AT SOUTHEAST ARIZONA GROUP PARKS AT 4 ESTABLISHED STUDY SITES FOLLOWING STANDARD WHITE NOSE SYNDROME PROTOCOL. THE SITES AT CORONADO NATIONAL MEMORIAL ARE IN CREEK BEDS WITH YEAR-ROUND SPRINGS AND AT WATER DRINKERS OUTSIDE ABANDONED MINE SITES. THE SITES AT CHIRICAHUA NATIONAL MONUMENT ARE IN CREEK BEDS WITH YEAR-ROUND SPRINGS. THE STUDY SITE AT FORT BOWIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE IS LOCATED NEAR THE A KNOWN AS A CAVE MYOTIS (MYOTIS VELIFER) ROOST. THIS IS AN IMPORTANT MATERNITY AND HIBERNATION ROOST FOR THIS SPECIES AND FOR IMPLICATIONS REGARDING WHITE NOSE SYNDROME. ONE SITE WILL BE NETTED PER EVENING WITH 1-3 NETS (EACH 8 M) DEPENDING ON THE SITE. NETS WILL BE SET UP BEFORE DARK AND KEPT OPEN FOR AT LEAST 2-4 HOURS. EACH BAT CAPTURED WILL BE EXAMINED FOR DISEASE, SPECIES, GENDER, REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH, AND WEIGHED. ANY OTHER PERTINENT OBSERVATIONS WILL BE NOTED. THE BATS WILL BE TURNED LOOSE AFTER COLLECTING THE DATA.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ONE SITE WILL BE SURVEYED AT LEAST ONCE A MONTH THROUGHOUT THE YEAR EXCEPT FOR APRIL THROUGH JUNE. APRIL, MAY, AND JUNE ARE DRY MONTHS IN ARIZONA AND PRODUCE THE MOST BATS AT NETTING LOCATIONS. DURING THE DRY PERIODS (APRIL-JUNE), WE WILL SET UP NETS AT EACH OF THE 4 SITES EACH MONTH FOR A TOTAL OF 12 NIGHTS TO OBTAIN THE MAXIMUM DATA. THE TOTAL SURVEY NIGHTS FOR THE ENTIRE YEAR WILL EQUAL AT LEAST 24, WITH A FEW EXTRA NIGHTS IN CASE WE GET RAINED-OUT. ALL DATA WILL BE ENTERED INTO AN ONGOING DATABASE BY THE BAT BIOLOGIST AND PROVIDED TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE IN AN ANNUAL REPORT. THE REPORT WILL INCLUDE TEXT, GRAPHS, PHOTOS, AND TABLES OF DATA. STATISTICAL ANALYSIS WILL BE EMPLOYED WHERE APPLICABLE.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE:1) THE PUBLIC2) THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY3) THE SOUTHEAST ARIZONA GROUP OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): BRUCE LOMBARDO WAS A LONG-TIME EMPLOYEE OF HOPEWELL CULTURE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK (HOCU) AND COMMUNITY MEMBER. A LOCAL CITIZEN WAS SO IMPRESSED BY MR. LOMBARDO'S PASSION FOR THE RESOURCES OF THE PARK HE AND HIS WIFE DONATED MONEY TO OHIO UNIVERSITY-CHILLICOTHE TO CREATE AN INTERNSHIP TO CONTINUE THE WORK OF MR. LOMBARDO. THE UNIVERSITY REACHED OUT TO THE PARK TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP AND CREATE INTERNSHIPS BENEFITING THE YOUTH OF RURAL OHIO. THE PROPOSED INTERNSHIP PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY TO FURTHER THE MISSION OF THE PARK. THE PARK HAS FUNDS HAS FUNDS AVAILABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF LOCAL STUDENTS TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THE NPS AND HOCU THROUGH SKILL BUILDING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. AS PART OF HOCU MISSION TO PRESERVE OUR CULTURAL RESOURCES, STUDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE RICH HISTORY OF OHIO, AND HOW THEY FIT INTO THE FABRIC OF THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM. THE PARK HIGHLIGHTS MAY LAYERS OF OHIO HISTORY WITH A SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON NATIVE AMERICAN CULTURES OF 2000 YEARS AGO. STUDENTS WILL WORK ALONGSIDE NPS INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION STAFF TO RESEARCH THE VARIETY OF CULTURES FOUND IN THE REGION AND HOW THEY HAVE IMPACTED THE HISTORY OF THE UNITED STATES. INTERNS WILL LEARN SKILLS IN INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND PRESENTATION, VISITOR SERVICES, CUSTOMER RELATIONS, VISITOR SAFETY AND BASIC EMPLOYMENT SKILLS THAT CAN HELP THEM GET AND KEEP A JOB IN THE FUTURE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE INTENT OF THIS INTERNSHIP IS TO CONTINUE HOCU'S LEGISLATIVE PURPOSE TO PRESERVE AND INTERPRET OHIO'S HISTORY PARTICULARLY THAT OF NATIVE AMERICAN PEOPLE FROM 2000 YEARS AGO. THE INTERNS WILL BE IMMERSED IN THE MANY LAYERS OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES TO GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE HOPEWELL CULTURE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK'S MISSION AND TIES TO THE COMMUNITY AND NATION. STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE ONGOING TRAINING FROM THE PARK AND WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF. THE INTERNS WILL DEVELOP SKILLS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. INTERNS WILL LEARN HOW TO INTERACT WITH THE PUBLIC, TO RUN PRE-EXISTING PROGRAMS, CREATE PERSONAL INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH PROGRAM THROUGH CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT/PRESENTATION. THE GOAL OF THESE PROGRAMS AND EDUCATION WILL BE TO INCREASE THE VISITING PUBLIC'S UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, HISTORIC, RECREATIONAL, AND OTHER ASPECTS OF HOPEWELL CULTURE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SEE MANAGE REPORTS FOR REPORTING PERIODS.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC, YOUTH, OHIO UNIVERSITY

THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO COLLABORATE WITH A CONSERVATION ORGANIZATION THAT PARALLELS NPS IN PROMOTING THE PRESERVATION AND INTEGRITY OF PUBLIC LANDS BY COORDINATING VOLUNTEERS TO PERFORM SELECTED PROJECTS ALONGSIDE NPS LANDSCAPING AND MAINTENANCE STAFF. THE NPS LANDSCAPING AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM TRADITIONALLY HOSTS NEARLY 2,500 INDIVIDUAL, COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WHO CONTRIBUTE 14,000 HOURS OF SERVICE PER YEAR THROUGHOUT THE GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA (GGNRA). THROUGH VOLUNTEER OUTREACH, RECRUITMENT, AND PROGRAMMING GGNPC WILL WORK WITH THE NPS TO CONNECT COMMUNITIES TO THEIR LOCAL NATIONAL PARKS; ENGAGE LOCAL CITIZENS IN PUBLIC LAND STEWARDSHIP; PROMOTE CONSERVATION AND PROTECTION OF PUBLIC LANDS; SUPPORT ACCESS TO OUTDOOR OPPORTUNITIES; EDUCATE VOLUNTEERS, INTERNS AND RECOMMENDED STAFF; AND RESTORE AND MAINTAIN HISTORIC LANDSCAPES AND FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE GGNRA.

THE DISCOVER WASHINGTON: YOUTH HERITAGE PROJECT (YHP) IS AN INTERACTIVE, OUTCOME-DRIVEN EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENGAGE 40-PLUS JUNIOR AND HIGH SCHOOL-AGE STUDENTS FROM WASHINGTON STATE. THE SUMMIT PROPOSED IN THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE HELD AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT OLYMPIC NATIONAL PARK. THROUGH SITE VISITS AND SEVERAL CASE STUDIES STUDENTS WILL LEARN, SEE AND EXPLORE HOW OLYMPIC NATIONAL PARK HAS BALANCED ITS MANDATE TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT WHILE AT THE SAME TIME MANAGING THE PARK ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE WILDERNESS ACT. STUDENTS WILL ALSO VISIT THE MAKAH INDIAN RESERVATION AND LEARN HOW THE MAKAH MANAGED THIS BALANCE FOR SEVERAL THOUSAND YEARS. AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO ANALYZE THESE EFFORTS AND PRESENT THEIR OWN ASSESSMENT AND FINDINGS.
